title: FEMA Didn’t Answer Thousands of Calls From Flood Survivors, Documents Show
summary: Two days after deadly Texas floods, the agency struggled to answer calls from survivors because of call center contracts that weren’t extended.

title: After Texas Disaster, Trump Shifts His Tone on FEMA
summary: Earlier this year, President Trump suggested he wanted to shutter the agency. Now, he says his aides “fixed it up in no time.”

title: Texas Flood Survivors Recount Night of Terror at Waterfront Campgrounds
summary: The half-mile stretch occupied by two campgrounds appears to have been one of the deadliest spots along the Guadalupe River in Central Texas during last week’s flash floods.

title: Trump Visits Texas Flood Sites: ‘Hell of a Situation, Isn’t It?’
summary: Mr. Trump and Melania Trump met with victims’ families and viewed some of the aftermath of last weekend’s flooding.

title: Air India Plane Crash Report Says Fuel to Engines Was Cut Off
summary: The focus on the fuel switches on Air India Flight 171 raised questions about the pilots’ actions.

title: Pam Bondi and FBI’s Dan Bongino Clash Over Handling of Epstein Case
summary: An irate attorney general is said to have confronted the deputy director of the F.B.I. at a tense White House meeting earlier in the week.

title: Energy Department to Gut Funding for Solar and Wind Projects
summary: Stripping hundreds of millions of dollars from renewable energy and efficiency initiatives is part of a broader move to undo efforts to wean the United States off fossil fuels.

title: As Trump Sows Tariff Confusion, Rules of Global Commerce Give Way to Chaos
summary: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will do next.

title: ‘Buy the Dip’ Wins Again for Stock Investors
summary: Individual investors were the ones who piled into stocks when they plunged in early April, while big Wall Street institutions missed out on the gains.

title: David Gergen, Washington Veteran Who Advised Four Presidents, Dies at 83
summary: After serving in the government, he became a prominent political commentator. “Centrism doesn’t mean splitting the difference,” he said.

title: Immigration Arrests in Los Angeles Spike Amid Aggressive Enforcement
summary: Nearly 3,000 people have been arrested since the beginning of June, more than three times the number in previous months this year.

title: Farmworker Dies After Fleeing a Federal Raid in Southern California
summary: During a chaotic raid in Ventura County on Thursday, the worker fell from a greenhouse at a cannabis farm, suffered spinal and skull injuries, and died on Friday.

title: Support for Immigration Rebounds as Trump Cracks Down on It, Poll Finds
summary: In a marked reversal from a year ago, more Americans now have positive views about immigration, and a record high believes it is good for the nation.

title: Judge Orders Los Angeles Police to Stop Shooting Projectiles at Journalists
summary: Los Angeles Police Department officers fired foam projectiles and flash-bang devices at reporters and photographers who were covering the immigration protests in June.

title: Amanda Anisimova Makes Wimbledon Final Years After Taking Extended Break
summary: The 23-year-old star could be the first American woman to win the tournament since 2016. A self-imposed sabbatical may have helped her get there.

title: Trump Says NATO Countries Will Buy Weapons to Give to Ukraine
summary: If the plan is finalized, it would allow critical aid to flow to Ukraine as it endures one of Russia’s heaviest assaults of the war.

title: Russia Sees France as Its Main Enemy in Europe, French General Says
summary: During a rare news conference on Friday, the head of the French military, Thierry Burkhard, said Russia remains a “lasting, close” threat.

title: How Netanyahu Prolonged the War in Gaza to Stay in Power
summary: Secret meetings, altered records, ignored intelligence: the inside story of the prime minister’s political calculations since Oct. 7.

title: Takeaways From the Times Investigation Into Benjamin Netanyahu
summary: Prolonging the Gaza war helped the Israeli prime minister forestall a political reckoning.

title: Netanyahu Ends Washington Trip Without a Gaza Truce
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister, met several times with President Trump, amid rising hopes of a cease-fire in Gaza, but there are still obstacles to a truce with Hamas.

title: Can ‘Superman’ Fly Above Today’s Polarized Politics?
summary: The director of the reboot, James Gunn, called the superhero from the planet Krypton “an immigrant,” thrusting the summer popcorn movie into an Earthbound culture war.

title: How James Gunn Modeled Superman’s Dog Krypto After His Own Pet
summary: For the furry sidekick, Krypto, in “Superman,” the director James Gunn found inspiration — and a physical model — in his own unruly pet.

title: Have Christians Finally Had It With Trump?
summary: The irreconcilable difference between Trumpian politics and Christianity.

title: U.S. Subpoenas Governor Who Said He Would House Migrant at His Home
summary: Federal prosecutors in New Jersey are investigating remarks that Gov. Philip D. Murphy, a Democrat, made in February.

title: ‘They Kept Coming’: Hundreds of Packages Pile Up Outside Woman’s Home
summary: A year ago, misdirected Amazon returns began arriving at Karen Holton’s house in California. Eventually, she said, they were stacked so high that she could not easily use her door.

title: Man Had 14 Toucans Stashed in His Volkswagen Dashboard, U.S. Says
summary: Carlos Abundez, 35, is facing federal smuggling charges after U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers made the discovery. The birds, a threatened species, were in stable condition.

title: Heat Warnings Issued for Parts of Eastern Canada
summary: Warnings were issued for southern Ontario and southwest Quebec as hot and humid weather is expected to linger through Thursday.
